alert.note: Alert for Boone (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 28 at 6:29PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Boone County through 715 PM EDT... At 627 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Julian, or near Madison, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Madison, Julian, Danville, Seth, Foster, Ashford and Racine. This includes Route 119 between mile markers 51 and 62. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
